intro: Lithophragma campanulatum, commonly known as the bellflower saxifrage, is a perennial flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Primulaceae family and is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils, often in alpine or subalpine habitats. It has basal leaves that are succulent and fleshy, adapted to retain moisture in arid environments. Lithophragma campanulatum is often used in rock gardens due to its ornamental value and hardy nature.
